Class List

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.utilities.todo.List
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class List
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A single list of tasks in a todo list

    todo project for CS56 W16
    Author:
    William Stevenson

        The task found

      • search

        public Task search(java.lang.String parentTaskName)
        Method that searches all of the tasks asscoiated with a TodoList object. Uses the findInOneComponent method on each level 1 task
        Parameters:
        parentTaskName - the name of the task being searched for
        Returns:
        the Task found

      • printByCompletion

        public void printByCompletion(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasklist)
        Uncompleted tasks are printed out in list form. I'd always envisioned this as a single list, but might add nested support, as it should be an easy fix
        Parameters:
        tasklist - list of tasks in todoList

      • printToday

                       int day,
                       int month,
                       int year)
        Prints the tasks that have a due date of the current day, month and year
        Parameters:
        tasklist - list of tasks in todoList
        day - day of the month
        month - the month of desired tasks
        year - the year of desired tasks

        Returns:
        Todolist read from serialized file

      • updateSortedList

        public void updateSortedList(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasklist,
                             java.util.ArrayList<Task> sortedList)
        The idea is that TodoList has a list of all tasks but is only updated when the user wants to sort by name or date. The list is first emptied and refilled with this function. This method does not sort the list
        Parameters:
        tasklist - the unsorted list
        sortedList - the list that will be populated with the unsorted list
